# AI Prompts for Wrapboxd Insights

These prompts can be passed to an AI to generate additional insights for the presentation.
Copy each prompt and ask your favorite AI model.

## Data availability (so the AI doesnâ€™t hallucinate)
- TMDB enrichment enabled: false
- TMDB genres available: false
- TMDB directors available: false
- TMDB runtimes available: false
- Letterboxd tags available: false



---

## Personality & Taste Analysis

### Prompt 1: Movie Personality Profile
Based on these movie watching stats, write a fun, Gen-Z style "movie personality profile" in 2-3 sentences:
- Total watches: 360
- Total unique films: 360
- Average rating: 3.40
- Most common rating: 3 stars
- Rewatches: 33 (9%)
- Busiest month: 2025-11 (66)
- Favorite weekday: Sun (87)
- Weekend share: 44%
- Longest streak: 11 days
- Biggest gap: 8 days



---

### Prompt 2: Watching Pattern Insight
Analyze my watching patterns and give me one surprising insight in a punchy, social-media-ready sentence:
- Films by month: [{"yearMonth":"2025-07","count":30},{"yearMonth":"2025-08","count":28},{"yearMonth":"2025-09","count":27},{"yearMonth":"2025-10","count":29},{"yearMonth":"2025-11","count":66},{"yearMonth":"2025-12","count":31}]
- Films by weekday: [{"weekday":"Sun","count":87},{"weekday":"Mon","count":48},{"weekday":"Tue","count":36},{"weekday":"Wed","count":36},{"weekday":"Thu","count":40},{"weekday":"Fri","count":41},{"weekday":"Sat","count":72}]
- Busiest month had 66 films
- Quietest month: 2025-01 (14)
- Longest streak: 11 days
- Biggest gap: 8 days
- Weekend share: 44%
- Top rewatches: [{"film":"13 Hours: The Secret Soldiers of Benghazi (2016)","count":1},{"film":"27 Dresses (2008)","count":1},{"film":"A Few Good Men (1992)","count":1},{"film":"Arrival (2016)","count":1},{"film":"Bridge of Spies (2015)","count":1},{"film":"Challengers (2024)","count":1},{"film":"Crazy Rich Asians (2018)","count":1},{"film":"Dear Evan Hansen (2021)","count":1},{"film":"Dune (2021)","count":1},{"film":"Dune: Part Two (2024)","count":1}]

---

### Prompt 3: Rating Style Analysis
Based on this rating distribution, describe my rating style in one memorable phrase (like "the generous critic" or "hard to impress"):
[{"rating":1,"count":7},{"rating":2,"count":41},{"rating":3,"count":149},{"rating":4,"count":124},{"rating":5,"count":37}]

---


## Fun Comparisons

### Prompt 7: Time Equivalents
I watched approximately 660 hours of movies. Write 5 fun comparisons of what else I could have done with that time (keep it playful, not judgmental).

---

### Prompt 8: Movie Superlatives
Based on all this data, give me 5 fun "superlatives" like yearbook awards (e.g., "Most Likely to Cry at Pixar", "Champion of 3-Hour Movies"):
{"avgRating":3.399441340782123,"totalFilms":360,"rewatchPct":9,"busiestMonth":"2025-11","topWeekday":"Sun","longestStreakDays":11}


---

### Prompt 9: Next Year Predictions
Based on my 2025 watching patterns, make 3 predictions for next year in a fun, horoscope-style format:
- This year: 360 films
- Favorite genre: Unknown
- Rating tendency: 3.4 average

---

### Prompt 10: Presentation Opener
Write a punchy, confident 2-sentence opener I can use when presenting this to coworkers. Make it self-aware and slightly self-deprecating about being a movie nerd.



---

## Specific Film Insights

### Prompt 11: Five-Star Analysis
I gave these films 5 stars: 
- Dune: Part Two (2024)
- Hotel Rwanda (2004)
- A Few Good Men (1992)
- Jack Reacher (2012)
- Game Night (2018)
- Burden of Dreams (1982)
- Cheaper by the Dozen (2003)
- Beyond the Infinite Two Minutes (2020)
- Ocean's Eleven (2001)
- Monsters, Inc. (2001)
- Freedom Writers (2007)
- The Double (2013)
- tick, tick... BOOM! (2021)
- Fire of Love (2022)
- The Ballad of Wallis Island (2025)
- Grease (1978)
- La La Land (2016)
- Superbad (2007)
- Ferris Bueller's Day Off (1986)
- One Week (1920)
- Big (1988)
- Arrival (2016)
- Scott Pilgrim vs. the World (2010)
- Rushmore (1998)
- Bridge of Spies (2015)

What do these films have in common? Give me one insight about my taste.

---

### Prompt 12: Controversial Picks
Write a "controversial opinion" style statement about my movie taste that I could use in the presentation, based on:
- Top genre: Unknown
- Average rating: 3.4
- Total films: 360
